intro: Sison capense, commonly known as the Cape sison, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, often forming a rounded cluster. Sison capense is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
